pull.title: [net] Avoid initialization to a value that is never read
pull.body: Prior to this commit the value stored to `s` at initialization was never read (in the case of `STRERROR_R_CHAR_P`).

rename.from: [trivial] Avoid initialization to a value that is never read
rename.to: [net] Avoid initialization to a value that is never read

events.body: In such cases, I personally prefer `const char *s;` at the beginning before conditional and then simple assignments.

events.message:
[net] Avoid initialization to a value that is never read

Prior to this commit the value stored to `s` at initialization
was never read (in the case of STRERROR_R_CHAR_P).

events.body: @paveljanik Good point! Changed and pushed. Looks good? :-)
@laanwj Do you have any input with regards to this change? If I'm reading the history correctly I think you've touched this specific function :-)

comments.body: It looks like, in the case of non-STRERROR_R_CHAR_P, you'll get an error on the line below.
@TheBlueMatt I'm not sure I follow. The intention is to keep the logic unchanged minus the redundant initialization. What am I missing? :-)
Ahh, somehow I missed the second line-addition, sorry.
